page.title: 01South East of Braidwood
page.content: The area slopes from Braidwood down the escarpent on north of River Clyde. In places the slope is steep and cut by the deep valleys of four streams which join the river. In 1981 Braidwood village had population of 399 in 151 households. It has 1 main street with Post Office/General Store and one primary school with present rol of 124. The main land cover is grassland and woodland. There are about 12 farms and 1 large private estate. Most of the farmland is used for rough grazing with some hay and silage production for sheep and cattle. Quite a number of new houses have been built privately recently in the area.Many are occupied by people who work in Glasgow and its industrial environs.
